definition: exerting all one's strength
ruthless/fierce/ferocious/determined/to harden (one's heart)/old variant of 很[hen3]
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Don't shake your fist at me.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒之下，他抓住孩子狠命地搖。

sentences.english: I would writhe my shoe some more and stare down at the worn rug.
sentences.chinese: 我盯着舊地毯，更狠命地蹂躪我的鞋。

sentences.english: In his anger Richard grasped the child and shook him violently .
sentences.chinese: 憤怒之下，理查德抓住孩子狠命地搖。

sentences.english: Victoria followed, hammering furiously upon his door.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞追將出來，狠命捶打房門。

sentences.english: Then he stomped me when I couldn't see.
sentences.chinese: 俺什麼也看不見了，他卻狠命踩俺。

sentences.english: In his anger he grasped the child and shook him violently.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒之下，他抓住孩子狠命地搖。

sentences.english: Shae's hands had beat at him as the golden hands dug into her throat.
sentences.chinese: 雪伊的手曾經狠命地打他同時他的金手挖進她的喉嚨。

definition: with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
doom/death/desperately
all one's strength/with might and main
erhua variant of 使勁|使劲[shi3 jin4]
resolutely/firmly/ferociously/ruthlessly
lit. without head, without face (idiom)/fig. frenzily/haphazardly
to whip/to flog/to thrash
erhua variant of 死勁|死劲[si3 jin4]
to do one's utmost
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to select
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
very fierce
to slam (into)/to smash (into)
to allow no explanation
to exert oneself physically
